Description: Terracotta cooking stove fragment. A pot-support broken from a cooking-stove. This differs from most in that the pot-rest, which is plain and conical, is placed high on a raised round-topped panel, well above the rim of the bowl. At the back is part of a sunken horizontal rectangle with a simple raised wave pattern within; below is part of a sunken rounded device, also with a wave pattern, following its shape. None of the fire-bowl survives, but it was probably wheel-made, and the support and panel hand-modelled. Micaceous brown Nile silt with a red and grey core, the top of the support and the side of the panel darkened by use.
Curator's comments: Published (Şahin 2001: 125, figs 129 an 130: Na 18). Şahin, M. 2001. Hellenistic braziers in the British Museum: Trade contacts between ancient Mediterranean cities. Anatolian Studies 51: 91-132.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3693)
Şahin 2001 / Hellenistic braziers in the British Museum: Trade contacts between ancient Mediterranean cities (p.125, figs 129 an 130: Na 18.)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (LA.39) (Phase 3)
